item.title: On Generating Ansible Playbooks Part 1
item.description: I'm pretty impressed with ansible. It honestly is the right tool for the job. It has a problem though. Its reliance on YAML. I feel this is where clojure can save the day. If only you had the following (run-playbook inventory plays) A playbook in this regime is a sequence of 'plays' which are clojure representation of the tasks which get composed out sequentially when writing a playbook.yml or the like.
